meanings.definition: The quality of being resistant to fading or changing color when exposed to light.
meanings.sent1: The painting's lightfastness ensured it would not fade in the sun.
meanings.sent2: Artists often look for markers with good lightfastness to preserve their work.
meanings.sent3: The lightfastness of the fabric made it the perfect choice for outdoor furniture.
meanings.sent4: Her friendship was like the lightfastness of a diamond, unwavering and enduring.
meanings.sent5: The lightfastness of the dye was so strong that even after years, the color remained vibrant.

meanings.definition: The ability of a material to retain its original color when exposed to light.
meanings.sent1: The lightfastness of the carpet meant it wouldn't fade near the window.
meanings.sent2: Choosing paint with good lightfastness is important for exterior walls.
meanings.sent3: The lightfastness of the curtains made them the envy of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: His loyalty was like the lightfastness of a rainbow, always bright and true.
meanings.sent5: The lightfastness of the ink was so impressive that the writing looked fresh for years.
